13: Address-to-Vaddr compatibility layer This contract implements a minimal virtual blockchain with the following features: - Virtual accounts with encrypted balances (euint64) - Virtual transactions with nonce-based replay protection - Virtual block progression with state commitments - Batch transfer processing - Admin functions for testing and maintenanceUsage Flow: 1. Deploy contract with vChainId and evvmID 2. Users register accounts with encrypted initial balances 3. Users perform transfers using encrypted amounts 4. State commitments are calculated off-chain and submitted on-chain 5. Virtual blocks track transaction historyLimitations (MVP): - No signature validation (nonce-only replay protection) - No async nonces support (sequential nonces only) - State commitments must be calculated off-chain - No staking, rewards, or treasury functionality - No cross-chain bridge supportFuture Improvements: - EIP-712 signature validation for transactions - Async nonces for parallel transaction processing - On-chain state commitment calculation (if gas-efficient) - Staking and validator system - Treasury and fee management - Cross-chain bridge integration","errors":{"OwnableInvalidOwner(address)":[{"details":"The owner is not a valid owner account. \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Strings.sol\";\nimport {FunctionId, ITaskManager, Utils, EncryptedInput, InEbool, InEuint8, InEuint16, InEuint32, InEuint64, InEuint128, InEuint256, InEaddress} from \"./ICofhe.sol\";\n\ntype ebool is uint256;\ntype euint8 is uint256;\ntype euint16 is uint256;\ntype euint32 is uint256;\ntype euint64 is uint256;\ntype euint128 is uint256;\ntype euint256 is /\\ /\\\n// ================================\n//solhint-disable const-name-snakecase\naddress constant TASK_MANAGER_ADDRESS = 0xeA30c4B8b44078Bbf8a6ef5b9f1eC1626C7848D9;\n\nlibrary Common {\n    error InvalidHexCharacter(bytes1 char);\n    error SecurityZoneOutOfBounds(int32 value);\n\n    // Default value for temp hash calculation in unary operations\n    string private constant DEFAULT_VALUE = \"0\";\n\n    function convertInt32ToUint256(int32 value) internal pure returns (uint256) {\n        if (value < 0) {\n            revert SecurityZoneOutOfBounds(value);\n        }\n        return uint256(uint32(value));\n    }\n\n    function isInitialized(uint256 hash) internal pure returns (bool) {\n        return hash != 0;\n    }\n\n    // Return true if the encrypted integer is initialized and false otherwise.\n    function isInitialized(ebool v) internal pure returns (bool) {\n        return isInitialized(ebool.unwrap(v));\n    }\n\n    // Return true if the encrypted }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x1ef83b66db01d3252557ae8b22553920966b864e9de79134039a80368eaae573","license":"BSD-3-Clause-Clear"},"@fhenixprotocol/cofhe-contracts/ICofhe.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: UNLICENSED\npragma solidity >=0.8.25 <0.9.0;\n\nstruct EncryptedInput {\n    uint256 ctHash;\n    uint8 securityZone;\n    uint8 utype;\n    bytes signature;\n}\n\nstruct InEbool {\n    uint256 ctHash;\n    uint8 securityZone;\n    uint8 utype;\n    bytes signature;\n}\n\nstruct InEuint8 {\n    uint256 ctHash;\n    uint8 securityZone;\n    uint8 utype;\n    bytes signature;\n}\n\nstruct InEuint16 {\n    uint256 ctHash;\n    uint8 securityZone;\n    uint8 utype;\n    bytes signature;\n}\n\nstruct InEuint32 {\n    uint256 ctHash;\n    uint8 securityZone;\n    uint8 utype;\n    bytes signature;\n}\n\nstruct InEuint64 {\n    uint256 ctHash;\n    uint8 securityZone;\n    uint8 utype;\n    bytes signature;\n}\n\nstruct InEuint128 {\n    uint256 ctHash;\n    uint8 securityZone;\n    uint8 utype;\n    bytes signature;\n}\n\nstruct InEuint256 {\n    uint256 ctHash;\n    uint8 securityZone;\n    uint8 utype;\n    bytes signature;\n}\nstruct InEaddress {\n    uint256 ctHash;\n    uint8 securityZone;\n    uint8 utype;\n    bytes signature;\n}\n\n\n// Order is set as in fheos/precompiles/types/types.go\nenum FunctionId {\n    _0,             // 0 - GetNetworkKey\n    _1,             // 1 - Verify\n    cast,           // 2\n    sealoutput,     // 3\n    select,         // 4 - select\n    _5,             // 5 - req\n    decrypt,        // 6\n    sub,            // 7\n    add,            // 8\n    xor,            // 9\n    and,            // 10\n    or,             // 11\n    not,            // 12\n    div,            // 13\n    rem,            // 14\n    mul,            // 15\n    shl,            // 16\n    shr,            // 17\n    gte,            // 18\n    lte,            // 19\n    lt,             // 20\n    gt,             // 21\n    min,            // 22\n    max,            // 23\n    eq,             // 24\n    ne,             // 25\n    trivialEncrypt, // 26\n    random,         // 27\n    rol,            // 28\n    ror,            // 29\n    square,         // 30\n    _31             // 31\n}\n\ninterface ITaskManager {\n    function createTask(uint8 returnType, FunctionId funcId, uint256[] memory encryptedInputs, uint256[] memory extraInputs) external returns (uint256);\n\n    function createDecryptTask(uint256 ctHash, address requestor) external;\n    function verifyInput(EncryptedInput memory input, address sender) external returns (uint256);\n\n    function allow(uint256 ctHash, address account) external;\n    function isAllowed(uint256 ctHash, address account) external returns (bool);\n    function allowGlobal(uint256 ctHash) external;\n    function allowTransient(uint256 ctHash, address account) external;\n    function getDecryptResultSafe(uint256 ctHash) external view returns (uint256, bool);\n    function getDecryptResult(uint256 ctHash) external view returns (uint256);\n}\n\nlibrary Utils {\n    // Values used to communicate types to the runtime.\n    // Must match values defined in warp-drive protobufs for everything to\n    uint8 internal constant EUINT8_TFHE = 2;\n    uint8 internal constant EUINT16_TFHE = 3;\n    uint8 internal constant EUINT32_TFHE = 4;\n    uint8 internal constant EUINT64_TFHE = 5;\n    uint8 internal constant EUINT128_TFHE = 6;\n    uint8 internal constant EUINT256_TFHE = 8;\n    uint8 internal constant EADDRESS_TFHE = 7;\n    uint8 internal constant EBOOL_TFHE = 0;\n\n    function functionIdToString(FunctionId _functionId) internal pure returns (string memory) {\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.cast) return \"cast\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.sealoutput) return \"sealOutput\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.select) return \"select\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.decrypt) return \"decrypt\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.sub) return \"sub\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.add) return \"add\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.xor) return \"xor\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.and) return \"and\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.or) return \"or\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.not) return \"not\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.div) return \"div\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.rem) return \"rem\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.mul) return \"mul\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.shl) return \"shl\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.shr) return \"shr\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.gte) return \"gte\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.lte) return \"lte\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.lt) return \"lt\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.gt) return \"gt\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.min) return \"min\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.max) return \"max\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.eq) return \"eq\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.ne) return \"ne\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.trivialEncrypt) return \"trivialEncrypt\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.random) return \"random\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.rol) return \"rol\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.ror) return \"ror\";\n        if (_functionId == FunctionId.square) return \"square\";\n\n        return \"\";\n    }\n\n    function inputFromEbool(InEbool memory input) internal pure returns (EncryptedInput memory) {\n        return EncryptedInput({\n            ctHash: input.ctHash,\n            securityZone: input.securityZone,\n            utype: EBOOL_TFHE,\n            signature: input.signature\n        });\n    }\n\n    function inputFromEuint8(InEuint8 memory input) internal pure returns (EncryptedInput memory) {\n        return EncryptedInput({\n            ctHash: input.ctHash,\n            securityZone: input.securityZone,\n            utype: EUINT8_TFHE,\n            signature: input.signature\n        });\n    }\n\n    function inputFromEuint16(InEuint16 memory input) internal pure returns (EncryptedInput memory) {\n        return EncryptedInput({\n            ctHash: input.ctHash,\n            securityZone: input.securityZone,\n            utype: EUINT16_TFHE,\n            signature: input.signature\n        });\n    }\n\n    function inputFromEuint32(InEuint32 memory input) internal pure returns (EncryptedInput memory) {\n        return EncryptedInput({\n            ctHash: input.ctHash,\n            securityZone: input.securityZone,\n            utype: EUINT32_TFHE,\n            signature: input.signature\n        });\n    }\n\n    function inputFromEuint64(InEuint64 memory input) internal pure returns (EncryptedInput memory) {\n        return EncryptedInput({\n            ctHash: input.ctHash,\n            securityZone: input.securityZone,\n            utype: EUINT64_TFHE,\n            signature: input.signature\n        });\n    }\n\n    function inputFromEuint128(InEuint128 memory input) internal pure returns (EncryptedInput memory) {\n        return EncryptedInput({\n            ctHash: input.ctHash,\n            securityZone: input.securityZone,\n            utype: EUINT128_TFHE,\n            signature: input.signature\n        });\n    }\n\n    function inputFromEuint256(InEuint256 memory input) internal pure returns (EncryptedInput memory) {\n        return EncryptedInput({\n            ctHash: input.ctHash,\n            securityZone: input.securityZone,\n            utype: EUINT256_TFHE,\n            signature: input.signature\n        });\n    }\n\n    function inputFromEaddress(InEaddress memory input) internal pure returns (EncryptedInput memory) {\n        return EncryptedInput({\n            ctHash: input.ctHash,\n            securityZone: input.securityZone,\n            utype: EADDRESS_TFHE,\n            signature: input.signature\n        });\n    }\n}","keccak256":"0x4f1bb532cd152e124638f5957ee43848d82a34df1c540c5dbf99ea72359e2db3","license":"UNLICENSED"},"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: As a result,\n            // the mask will either be `bytes32(0)` (if n is positive) or `~bytes32(0)` (if n is negative).\n            int256 mask = n >> 255;\n\n            // A `bytes32(0)` mask leaves the input unchanged, while a `~bytes32(0)` mask complements it.\n            return uint256((n + mask) ^ mask);\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xb1970fac7b64e6c09611e6691791e848d5e3fe410fa5899e7df2e0afd77a99e3","license":"MIT"},"contracts/core/EVVM.core.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.24;\n\nimport \"@fhenixprotocol/cofhe-contracts/FHE.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol\";\n\n\n/// @title EVVM Core - Virtual Blockchain with FHE\n/// @notice MVP of EVVM Core as \"virtual blockchain\" using FHE for private balances\n/// @dev Step 13: Address-to-Vaddr compatibility layer\n/// \n/// @dev This contract implements a minimal virtual blockchain with the following features:\n/// - Virtual accounts with encrypted balances (euint64)\n/// - Virtual transactions with nonce-based replay protection\n/// - Virtual block progression with state commitments\n/// - Batch transfer processing\n/// - Admin functions for testing and maintenance\n///\n/// @dev Usage Flow:\n/// 1. Deploy contract with vChainId and evvmID\n/// 2. Users register accounts with encrypted initial balances\n/// 3. Users perform transfers using encrypted amounts\n/// 4. State commitments are calculated off-chain and submitted on-chain\n/// 5. Virtual blocks track transaction history\n///\n/// @dev Limitations (MVP):\n/// - No signature validation (nonce-only replay protection)\n/// - No async nonces support (sequential nonces only)\n/// - State commitments must be calculated off-chain\n/// - No staking, rewards, or treasury functionality\n/// - No cross-chain bridge support\n///\n/// @dev Future Improvements:\n/// - EIP-712 signature validation for transactions\n/// - Async nonces for parallel transaction processing\n/// - On-chain state commitment calculation (if gas-efficient)\n/// - Staking and validator system\n/// - Treasury and fee management\n/// - Cross-chain bridge integration\ncontract EVVMCore is Ownable {\n    // ============ Structs ============\n    \n    /// @notice Represents an account within the virtual blockchain\n    struct VirtualAccount {\n        euint64 balance;      // Encrypted balance of the principal token\n        uint64 nonce;         // Transaction counter from this account (public for replay protection)\n        bool exists;          // Existence flag\n    }\n    \n    /// @notice Represents a virtual transaction in the blockchain\n    struct VirtualTransaction {\n        bytes32 fromVaddr;    // Source virtual account\n        bytes32 toVaddr;      // Destination virtual account\n        euint64 amountEnc;    // Encrypted amount transferred\n        uint64 nonce;         // Nonce used in this transaction\n        uint64 vBlockNumber;  // Virtual block number when transaction was applied\n        uint256 timestamp;    // Block timestamp when transaction was applied\n        bool exists;          // Existence flag\n    }\n    \n    /// @notice Parameters for a batch transfer operation\n    struct TransferParams {\n        bytes32 fromVaddr;    // Source virtual account\n        bytes32 toVaddr;      // Destination virtual account\n        InEuint64 amount;     // Encrypted amount to transfer\n        uint64 expectedNonce; // Expected nonce for the source account\n    }\n    \n    /// @notice Represents a virtual block in the blockchain\n    struct VirtualBlock {\n        uint64 blockNumber;   // Block number\n        bytes32 stateCommitment; // State commitment at this block\n        uint256 timestamp;     // Block timestamp\n        uint256 transactionCount; // Number of transactions in this block\n        bool exists;           // Existence flag\n    }\n\n    // ============ State Variables ============\n    \n    /// @notice Virtual chain ID (immutable)\n    uint64 public immutable vChainId;\n    \n    /// @notice Current height of the \"virtual blockchain\"\n    uint64 public vBlockNumber;\n    \n    /// @notice EVVM ID for future signature verification\n    uint256 public evvmID;\n    \n    /// @notice Cryptographic commitment to IDs at 1\n    }\n    \n    // ============ Virtual Account Management ============\n    \n    /// @notice Registers a new account in the virtual blockchain with initial encrypted balance\n    /// Virtual Transactions ============\n    \n    /// @notice Applies a transfer within the virtual blockchain\n    /// @dev Transaction model: (from, to, amount, nonce, chainId)\n    /// @dev For MVP we If false, caller handles it (for batches)\n    function _applyTransferInternal(\n        bytes32 fromVaddr,\n        bytes32 toVaddr,\n        InEuint64 calldata amount,\n        uint64 expectedNonce,\n        bool incrementBlock\n    ) public returns (uint256 txId) {\n        require(accounts[fromVaddr].exists, \"EVVM: from account missing\");\n        require(accounts[toVaddr].exists, \"EVVM: to account missing\");\n        \n        VirtualAccount storage fromAcc = accounts[fromVaddr];\n        VirtualAccount storage toAcc = accounts[toVaddr];\n encrypted value\n        // This is necessary when the value comes from external sources (frontend)\n        // and may not have the correct permissions set yet\n        FHE.allowGlobal(amountEnc);\n   \n        // Update balances\n        fromAcc.balance = newFromBalance;\n        toAcc.balance = newToBalance;\n        \n        // Set permissions IMMEDIATELY after updating balances\n        // Use allowGlobal() to allow anyone with a valid permit to decrypt\n        // The frontend will create the necessary permits (self + sharing with contract)\n        FHE.allowThis(newFromBalance);\n        FHE.allowThis(newToBalance);\n        FHE.allowGlobal(newFromBalance);\n        FHE.allowGlobal(newToBalance);\n        \n        // Capture the nonce that was used for this transaction (before usedNonce,\n            eventBlockNumber,\n            txId\n        );\n        \n        return txId;\n    }\n\n    // ============ Virtual Block Management ============\n    \n    /// @notice \n        // Allow this contract to operate on the balance\n        FHE.allowThis(balance);\n        // Use allowGlobal() to allow anyone with a valid permit to decrypt\n        // The frontend will Amount is already converted and has permissions set\n        // FHE arithmetic on encrypted balances\n        euint64 newFromBalance = FHE.sub(fromAcc.balance, amountEnc);\n        euint64 newToBalance = FHE.add(toAcc.balance, amountEnc);\n        \n        // Update balances\n        fromAcc.balance = newFromBalance;\n        toAcc.balance = newToBalance;\n        \n        // Set permissions on the new balances so users can decrypt them\n        // Use allowGlobal() to allow anyone with a valid permit to decrypt\n        // The frontend will create the necessary permits (self + sharing with contract)\n        FHE.allowThis(newFromBalance);\n        FHE.allowThis(newToBalance);\n        FHE.allowGlobal(newFromBalance);\n        FHE.allowGlobal(newToBalance);\n        \n        // Capture the nonce that was used for this transaction (before increment)\n        uint64 usedNonce = fromAcc.nonce;\n        \n        // Increment nonce\n        fromAcc.nonce += 1;\n        \n        // Increment virtual block number\n        vBlockNumber += 1;\n        \n        // Create or update block information\n        if (!virtualBlocks[vBlockNumber].exists) {\n            virtualBlocks[vBlockNumber] = VirtualBlock({\n                blockNumber: vBlockNumber,\n                stateCommitment: bytes32(0), // Will be set off-chain\n                timestamp: block.timestamp,\n                transactionCount: 1,\n                exists: true\n            });\n            emit VirtualBlockCreated(vBlockNumber, bytes32(0));\n        } else {\n            virtualBlocks[vBlockNumber].transactionCount += 1;\n            virtualBlocks[vBlockNumber].timestamp = block.timestamp;\n        }\n        \n        // Store transaction\n        txId = nextTxId;\n        nextTxId += 1;\n        \n        virtualTransactions[txId] = VirtualTransaction({\n            fromVaddr: fromVaddr,\n            toVaddr: toVaddr,\n            amountEnc: amountEnc,\n            nonce: usedNonce,\n            vBlockNumber: vBlockNumber,\n            timestamp: block.timestamp,\n            exists: true\n        });\n        \n        // Emit event\n        emit VirtualTransferApplied(\n            fromVaddr,\n            toVaddr,\n            amountEnc,\n            usedNonce,\n            vBlockNumber,\n            txId\n        );\n        \n        return txId;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x7b2acb9300a26af14c1ab227da1319d16d697aa1e1014118010299257cc249a8","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

devdoc.details: Step 13: Address-to-Vaddr compatibility layer This contract implements a minimal virtual blockchain with the following features: - Virtual accounts with encrypted balances (euint64) - Virtual transactions with nonce-based replay protection - Virtual block progression with state commitments - Batch transfer processing - Admin functions for testing and maintenanceUsage Flow: 1. Deploy contract with vChainId and evvmID 2. Users register accounts with encrypted initial balances 3. Users perform transfers using encrypted amounts 4. State commitments are calculated off-chain and submitted on-chain 5. Virtual blocks track transaction historyLimitations (MVP): - No signature validation (nonce-only replay protection) - No async nonces support (sequential nonces only) - State commitments must be calculated off-chain - No staking, rewards, or treasury functionality - No cross-chain bridge supportFuture Improvements: - EIP-712 signature validation for transactions - Async nonces for parallel transaction processing - On-chain state commitment calculation (if gas-efficient) - Staking and validator system - Treasury and fee management - Cross-chain bridge integration

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

params.realAddress: The Ethereum address that was registered

params.amountAdded: The encrypted amount that was added
params.vaddr: The virtual address that received the balance

params.newCommitment: The new state commitment (e.g., Merkle root)

params.initialNonce: The initial nonce (always 0 for new accounts)
params.vaddr: The virtual address of the registered account

params.stateCommitment: The state commitment for this block

params.nonce: The nonce used in this transaction
params.vBlockNumber: The virtual block number when the transaction was applied

_applyTransferInternal(bytes32,bytes32,(.details: This public function allows batch processing with try/catchShould only be called internally or via applyTransfer()

params.incrementBlock: If true, increments vBlockNumber (for single transfers). If false, caller handles it (for batches)

returns._0: exists True if the account exists

applyTransfer(bytes32,bytes32,(uint256,u.details: Transaction model: (from, to, amount, nonce, chainId)For MVP we don't validate signatures, only check nonce and existenceThis function increments the virtual block number automaticallyReverts if:      - Source or destination account doesn't exist      - Nonce doesn't match the account's current nonceEmits VirtualTransferApplied eventUpdates virtual block number and stores transaction

params.expectedNonce: Nonce that the caller believes `fromVaddr` has

returns.txId: Transaction ID (unique identifier for this transaction)

applyTransferBatch((bytes32,bytes32,(uin.details: All successful transfers are grouped into one virtual block. Failed transfers are skipped.This function uses try/catch to handle individual transfer failures gracefullyIf all transfers fail, the block number increment is revertedReverts if the transfers array is emptyEach successful transfer emits a VirtualTransferApplied event

params.transfers: Array of transfer parameters to process

returns.txIds: Array of transaction IDs for successful transfers (0 for failed ones)

params._evvmID: EVVM ID for future signature verification

createVirtualBlock(bytes32).details: This function allows explicit block creation with a cryptographic commitmentValidates that the commitment is not empty and that block number increments correctly

params.newCommitment: The state commitment for the new block (e.g., Merkle root of all accounts)

faucetAddBalance(bytes32,(uint256,uint8,.details: This function is useful for testing and developmentIt adds encrypted balance to an existing account without affecting the nonce

params.vaddr: The virtual address of the account to add balance to

generateVaddrFromAddress(address,bytes32.details: This is a helper function to create deterministic vaddr from Ethereum addressesFormula: keccak256(abi.encodePacked(realAddress, vChainId, evvmID, salt))

params.salt: Optional salt for additional entropy (use bytes32(0) for default)

getAccount(bytes32).details: Returns balance (encrypted), nonce, and exists flag

getBlockInfo(uint64).details: Returns block number, state commitment, timestamp, and transaction count

params.blockNumber: The virtual block number to query

returns.blockInfo: The virtual block struct with all block information

getEncryptedBalance(bytes32).details: Frontend uses cofhesdkClient.decryptHandle(...) to see the plaintext value

getVaddrFromAddress(address).details: Returns bytes32(0) if the address has not been registered via registerAccountFromAddress()

returns._0: vaddr The virtual address associated with the Ethereum address, or bytes32(0) if not registered

getVirtualTransaction(uint256).details: Returns a struct with all transaction details including encrypted amount

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

registerAccount(bytes32,(uint256,uint8,u.details: vaddr can be keccak256(pubkey), hash of real address, or any unique bytes32The account will be initialized with nonce 0 and the provided encrypted balanceFHE permissions are automatically set for the contract and senderReverts if the account already existsEmits VirtualAccountRegistered event

params.vaddr: Virtual identifier of the account (pseudonym, not linked on-chain to real user)

registerAccountFromAddress(address,(uint.details: Automatically generates vaddr from the Ethereum address using vChainId and evvmIDThis function creates a mapping between the real address and the generated vaddrReverts if the account already exists (either by address or by generated vaddr)Emits AccountRegisteredFromAddress event

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

requestPay(address,address,(uint256,uint.details: This function bridges the gap between traditional contracts and the virtual blockchainIt looks up the vaddr for each address and calls applyTransfer()Reverts if either address is not registeredReverts with the same errors as applyTransfer() (bad nonce, account missing, etc.)IMPORTANT: The encrypted amount must have permissions for this contract before calling      The frontend should create a sharing permit for EVVMCore before calling this functionTEMPORARY WORKAROUND: This function attempts to handle the conversion with better error messages

params.expectedNonce: Nonce that the caller believes the sender's account has
params.from: The Ethereum address of the sender
params.to: The Ethereum address of the recipient

returns.txId: Transaction ID (unique identifier for this transaction)

setEvvmID(uint256).details: This function allows the contract owner to update the EVVM IDThe EVVM ID is used for signature verification and vaddr generation

params.newEvvmID: The new EVVM ID to set

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateStateCommitment(bytes32).details: Useful for updating the commitment when state changes occurValidates that the commitment is not emptyUpdates the current block's commitment if it existsReverts if newCommitment is zeroEmits StateCommitmentUpdated event

params.newCommitment: The new state commitment (must not be bytes32(0))

updateStateCommitmentAfterBatch(bytes32).details: This function should be called after applyTransferBatch() to update the commitmentUseful for maintaining accurate state commitments after batch operations

params.newCommitment: The new state commitment calculated off-chain after the batch
